Version: 1.9 (using KDE KDE 3.5.0) Installed from: Compiled From Sources OS: Linux
At the moment the "Delete" command behaves differently whether it's executed from mail in open thread or from parent with closed thread. I case of open thread it deletes only active letter, but in case of closed thread it deletes active letter and all its children. Current "Delete thread" command is found to be confusing as well - it deletes whole thread, not active letter and its children.
The proposal to make it cleaner: * "Delete thread" deletes always only active letter and all its children. * "Delete" deletes always only active letter. In case of active letter being parent with closed thread, it ("Delete" command) shouldn't be available in menu at all.
All this is valid for "Move to Trash" and "Move Thread to Trash" commands as well of course.
